Articles.Content:
Kinda self-explanatory. You basically build off the room the last member built.

Ex:

Player 1: Living room with giant computer to play KSP with 4 doors.

Player 2: Door 2 leads to the runway/airport/ Has 2 doors

Player 3: The 3rd door from the living room leads to...

And so on...

Rules:

Must have a door

Don't repeat.

I'll make floors a thing once this gets past 3 pages.

I'll start:

The main door leads to the main hall with lots of snack vendors, and main desk. A bunch of computers (no desktops) are here so KSP can be played in any room. There are 5 doors: Two lead to hangers and garages, there are 3 free doors.
One door leads to a workshop to build real planes and rockets, with one door.

That door leads to a nuclear missile silo, with 2 doors.

(The door from pTrevTrevs post).
A room with 1 door that leads to a teleported that goes to Kerbin. It's two-way.
One door from the original post leads to a wind tunnel to test aerodynamics and stuff. I has 2 doors

One of those two doors leads to a bathroom. It is sparsely furnished, because everyone wants to spend as little time as possible in there not playing KSP. It of course has a door leading back to the previous room.

Edited November 9, 2015 by parameciumkid
One of the first 3 doors go to Tech Support, wand self sustaining life support so we can justify them staying locked in there permanently. This room has no other doors.
